cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 380 miles SE of Miami, Florida and 225 miles E of Caibarién, Cuba

motion.direction: W (expected to bend WNW later today, then NW Saturday)

cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-northwest along the north coast of Cuba, then turning northwest toward the Florida Keys and up the Florida Peninsula before arcing north-northwest into Georgia and the southeastern U.S.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Keys / extreme South Florida coast (primary landfall), then tracking inland toward north Florida

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for Georgia as of Advisory 38A
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and storm-surge warnings confined to S & central Florida coast at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coast from the Florida Keys northward to coastal Georgia and South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: High chance (up to 68%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds by Monday with a 31% chance they exceed 50 kt; brief hurricane-force gusts possible if track shifts east.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge 3-6 ft possible along the Georgia coast and estuaries around the time of closest approach, especially during high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–12 inches of rain (isolated 16 inch pockets) forecast for coastal Georgia, producing flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; isolated tornadoes in outer rain-bands; possible river flooding inland.
